meanings.definition: Excessive admiration or worship of William Shakespeare.
meanings.sent1: Her bardolatry knew no bounds as she collected every book written by Shakespeare.
meanings.sent2: The theater was filled with bardolatry as the audience applauded the performance of 'Hamlet'.
meanings.sent3: At the Shakespeare-themed party, her bardolatry was evident in her costume resembling Juliet.
meanings.sent4: His bardolatry was like a beacon, drawing all literature enthusiasts to his Shakespearean discussions.
meanings.sent5: The bardolatry in the air was palpable, as if Shakespeare himself was present in the room.

meanings.definition: The idolization of Shakespeare and his works.
meanings.sent1: The school library displayed a sense of bardolatry with its extensive collection of Shakespearean plays.
meanings.sent2: Fans of bardolatry often travel to Stratford-upon-Avon to visit Shakespeare's birthplace.
meanings.sent3: His bardolatry reached new heights when he named his pet cat 'Shakespeare'.
meanings.sent4: The bardolatry of the literary world shone brightly during the Shakespearean festival.
meanings.sent5: In her room, posters of Shakespeare's quotes covered the walls, a true display of bardolatry.
